submission_categories.description: Describing novel contributions involving managed language platforms.
submission_categories.format: Up to 12 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix

submission_categories.description: Describing hot topics or promising new ideas, with perhaps less maturity than full papers.
submission_categories.format: Up to 6 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix

submission_categories.description: Presenting technical challenges and solutions for managed language platforms in the context of deployed applications and systems.
submission_categories.format: Up to 6 pages, excluding bibliography and appendix; up to 12 pages allowed if justified by the content

publication_details.accepted_submissions: Published in the ACM Digital Library, except if authors prefer not to be included.
publication_details.poster_session: MPLR 2025 will not hold its own poster session.

submission_guidelines: Use ACM SIGPLAN format with the sigplan style.
Submissions need to be in PDF format.
Use the acmart document class with the sigplan option.
Authors should not show their names on a submission and refer to their own work in the third person.

summary.event: 22nd International Conference on Managed Programming Languages & Runtimes (MPLR)
summary.description: A premier forum for presenting and discussing novel results in all aspects of managed programming languages and runtime systems.

topics: Managed languages (e.g., Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C#, F#, etc.)
Portable intermediate representations (e.g., JVM, WebAssembly, RPython, ...)
Managed runtime systems (e.g., GraalVM, Android Runtime (ART), V8, etc.)
